definition: outline/main threads
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
beginnings/clues/mental state/thread

sentences.english: But that price detail may turn a lot of heads.
sentences.chinese: 但是价格的细节可能会牵出很多头绪。

sentences.english: How can you sort out the order from the chaos?
sentences.chinese: 如何才能从混沌世界中理出头绪来呢？

sentences.english: These must be some illiterate ignorant and clueless Senators.
sentences.chinese: 这些参议员肯定是文盲蠢蛋毫无头绪的。

sentences.english: I don’t think I had a clue.
If that is so, move on or go back to the drawing board.
sentences.chinese: 如果是这样的话，还是回去举动茫无头绪。

sentences.english: When a relationship is real, it's growing;
sentences.chinese: 很多时候，我们没有头绪，被一叶障目。

sentences.english: Under National we are drifting without a plan.
sentences.chinese: 在国家党治下，我们正茫无头绪地漂流。

sentences.english: Often say "cut the Gordian knot" and the knife can continue, but more threads.
sentences.chinese: 常说“快刀斩乱麻”，可这一刀下去，头绪却更多了。

sentences.english: She had never known her thoughts to be so confused, unable to gather anything from them.
sentences.chinese: 她的思绪从来没有这么乱过，丝毫理不出头绪。

sentences.english: There are many reasons leading to these problems and they are always hydra-headed and complex.
sentences.chinese: 导致这些问题出现的原因很多，头绪纷繁复杂。

sentences.english: I felt as if I was the only one in the room who didn’t have a clue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉自己好像是教室里唯一一个没有一点头绪的人。

sentences.english: The second one is a total mystery.
sentences.chinese: 第二个是至今仍毫无头绪的未解之谜。

sentences.english: A lyricist without a clue, what year is this?
sentences.chinese: 没有头绪的诗人，这是哪年的？

sentences.english: Usually you can break down the process of the clueless man in a few simple steps.
sentences.chinese: 你可以从以下这些没有头绪的男性中琢磨出一些东西。

sentences.english: After an unthinking moment, she put the pen into her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 想了一会儿，她还是没有什么头绪，便将笔咬在嘴里。

definition: plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
the reason why
to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
lit. tangled skein/in a tremendous muddle/confused
not know where to start
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to fail to grasp the main points
to figure out how to do something
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to figure out/to realize/to become convinced/to come round (to an idea)/to get over it
lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
arrangement/order/tidiness
